info.title: Access Control Api
info.description:
This api allows manipulating user and user group permissions for apps and meta sites.

# Permission overview
**Permission** is a group of specific **actions** that user can perform on entities.

**App permissions**:


| ↓ Action  \  Permission → | view | edit | edit-publish | manage |
|---------------------------|:----:|:----:|:------------:|:------:|
| view                      | ✔    | ✔    | ✔            | ✔      |
| edit                      |      | ✔    | ✔            | ✔      |
| publish                   |      |      | ✔            | ✔      |
| manage                    |      |      |              | ✔      |


Detailed description of app actions:

- view - allows viewing an app
- edit - allows editing an app
- publish - allows publishing changes in Tag Manager module
- manage - allows managing user permissions for an app
- add - allows adding apps (owner only)
- delete - allows deleting an app (owner only)

**Meta site permissions**:

| ↓ Action  \  Permission → | view | edit | manage |
|---------------------------|:----:|:----:|:------:|
| view                      | ✔    | ✔    | ✔      |
| edit                      |      | ✔    | ✔      |
| view_details              |      |      | ✔      |
| edit_details              |      |      | ✔      |
| list_apps_in_meta_site    |      |      | ✔      |
| manage                    |      |      | ✔      |


Detailed description of meta site actions:

- view - allows viewing meta site in Analytics module
- edit - allows editing meta site reports in Analytics module
- view_details - allows viewing meta site details in Administration module
- edit_details - allows editing meta site details in Administration module
- list_apps_in_meta_site - allows listing apps in a meta site
- manage - allows managing user permissions for a meta site
- add - allows creating new meta site (owner only)
- delete - allows deleting meta site (owner only)
- add_app_to_meta_site - allows adding apps to a meta site (owner only)
- remove_app_from_meta_site - allows removing apps from a meta site (owner only)

get.description: Returns granted actions to a given entity for current user.
Returns apps with granted action for current user.
Returns meta sites with granted action for current user.
Returns users with granted action for current user.
It gets actions without specific entity context for a given user.

get.summary: Users permissions for a given app
get.description:
Lists all users (but not owners) and their permissions for a given app.
List contains both explicit permission of a user and implicit highest permission inherited from user groups which user belongs to.

get.summary: User groups permissions for a given app
get.description: Lists all user groups and their permissions for a given app.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort field - can be reversed by adding dash before field name e.g (-name)

get.summary: Users permissions for a given meta site
get.description:
Lists all users (but not owners) and their permissions for a given meta site.
List contains both explicit permission of a user and implicit highest permission inherited from user groups which user belongs to.

get.summary: User groups permissions for a given meta site
get.description: Lists all user groups and their permission for a given meta site.

post.summary: Set user permission for a given app
post.description: Sets user permission for a given app

requestBody.description: Request data to set permission for an app for a user

post.summary: Set user group permission for a given app
post.description: It sets permission for a given app for a user group

requestBody.description: Request data to set permission for an app for a user group

post.summary: Set user permission for a given meta site
post.description: It sets permission for a given meta site for a user

requestBody.description: Request data to set permission for a meta site for a user

post.summary: Set user group permission for a given meta site
post.description: It sets permission for a given meta site for a user group

requestBody.description: Request data to set permission for a meta site for a user group

post.description:
Please use Set user permission for a given app instead.

It sets permission for a given entity (ppms/user or ppms/app).

get.description:
Please use Users permissions for a given app instead.

Lists all users (but not owners) and their permissions for a given app. List contains both explicit permission of a user and implicit highest permission inherited from user groups which user belongs to.

Get list of apps

Full example: ``` /api/apps/v2?offset=100&limit=10&sort=name&search=nifty+marketing ``` this will list 10 apps ordered ascending by `name` starting on 101th matching search query "nifty marketing".

post.description: It adds app

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value

title.description: a short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Like `title`, this field’s value can be localized

source.description: an object containing references to the source of the error, optionally including any of the following members: [pointer, parameter]

pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/name" for a specific attribute]

parameter.description: a string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error

errors.title: Invalid form
errors.detail: This value is too long. It should have 90 characters or less.

get.description: Get app permissions
Get apps permission for user group

List of Audit Log entries

To specify filters use `?filter[name]=value` syntax (e.g. `?filter[type]=app.added,app.edited`)

To return csv instead of json, use `Accept: text/csv` header

get.description: Lists meta sites

post.description:
Adds meta site with unique name. You can add apps to this meta site in
[/api/meta-sites/v1/{meta_site_id}/relationships/apps](#operation/add_apps_to_meta_site_v1) endpoint.

requestBody.description: Request data to add new meta site

get.description: Gets meta site

requestBody.description: Request data to edit existing meta site

post.description: Adds apps to meta site. You can add up to 1000 apps to meta site in one api call.

requestBody.description: Request data to add apps to meta site

delete.description: Removes apps from meta site. You can remove up to 1000 apps from meta site in one api call.

requestBody.description: Request data to remove apps from meta site

get.description: Lists apps that belong to given meta site

get.summary: List apps excluded from meta site
get.description: Lists apps that don't belong to given meta site

Get list of apps with meta sites. App with `demo` type will be always first on the list if exists (sorting method is irrelevant)


Full example:
```
/api/meta-sites/v1/apps-with-meta-sites?offset=100&limit=10&search=nifty+marketing&action=edit
```
this will list 10 apps and meta sites which I have access to (can execute `edit` action) starting on 101th matching search query "nifty marketing".
It informs whether all apps of given meta site have the same currency and timezone as meta site itself

valid_currency.description: Flag indicating that all apps of given meta site have the same currency as meta site itself

valid_timezone.description: Flag indicating that all apps of given meta site have the same timezone as meta site itself

get.description: List of licensed modules with access for a current user

post.description: List of modules with access for a list of users

get.description: Returns module if it is licensed and user has access to it

get.summary: Modules access list for a given user
get.description:
Lists all modules to which a given user has access to.
List contains both explicit access for a user and implicit access inherited from user groups which user belongs to.

put.summary: Set modules access for a given user
put.description: Sets modules access for a given user

delete.description: It deletes given tracker setting of an app. Then global setting will be used instead.

get.summary: Get tracker settings of an app by it's url
get.description: It gets tracker settings of an app that first matched against given url. Used mostly in log analytics for website autorecognition.

get.description:
### JSON API compatibility divergence

#### Filters
In JSON API standard (https://jsonapi.org/recommendations/#filtering) one can request elements with multiple
filter values by simply providing them separated by coma:

`tags?filter[template]=piwik,adroll`

This notation will not work here. You can achieve this functionality by providing multiple filters for the same parameter:

`tags?filter[template][]=piwik&filter[template][]=adroll`

parameters.description: Filter tags by being prioritized or not

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Comma-separated sort list with given attributes: name, is_active, tag_type, priority, created_at, updated_at.

Sorting by `priority` (and `-priority`) sorts also by primary key to keep stable order of tags with same priority.

get.description:
### JSON API compatibility divergence

#### Filters
In JSON API standard (https://jsonapi.org/recommendations/#filtering) one can request elements with multiple
filter values by simply providing them separated by coma:

`variables?filter[variable_type]=url,constant`

This notation will not work here. You can achieve this functionality by providing multiple filters for the same parameter:

`variables?filter[variable_type][]=url&filter[variable_type][]=constant`

parameters.name: page[limit]
parameters.description: Limits the number of returned items

parameters.name: page[offset]
parameters.description: Sets offset for list of items

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Comma-separated sort list with given attributes: name, variable_type, created_at, updated_at

builtin.description: Flag indicating whether variable is custom or builtin

is_published.description: Flag describing whether variable is published (true) or not published (false)

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

source.description: An object containing references to the source of the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI parameter caused the error.

meta.description: An object containing additional application-specific information about error.

errors.detail: Application identifier should be of type UUID
There is no application with given identifier: 5c39070d-9e0b-40a2-ae56-392f05711f74
The attribute expected to be of type string but integer given.
Maintenance mode enabled for organization (organization: default)

extract_text_content.description: Flag indicating whether you want extract only text or whole element

default_value.description: Value that will be returned if none of the mapping key is matched.

anyOf.description: Static text to be returned when value was not found in the table
Variable identifier to be returned when value was not found in the table

items.description: Lookup table input and output pair

anyOf.title: Variable reference
anyOf.description: Tag Manager's variable reference, example `{{ Campaign }}`

patch.description: It is possible to edit variable's type. Just make a request with a new type and all required attributes from its schema.

202.description: Operation data with new (copied) variable identifier

get.description:
### JSON API compatibility divergence

#### Filters
In JSON API standard (https://jsonapi.org/recommendations/#filtering) one can request elements with multiple
filter values by simply providing them separated by coma:

`versions?filter[version_type][]=published,draft`

This notation will not work here. You can achieve this functionality by providing multiple filters for the same parameter:

`versions?filter[version_type][]=published&filter[version_type][]=draft`

Always false for published and historic versions

post.description:
API that allows querying the database directly. Please note that each
request must be authenticated.

#### Copy definition

You can use the **View API call definition** option
available in Analytics module in each report to get more
usage examples based on your existing reports.

![View API call definition](../../_static/images/copy-api-call.png)


#### Compression

When requesting large amount of data, make sure to include
an **Accept-Encoding: gzip** header to enable
compression.


#### Cache

Please note that all query results are cached for 10 minutes.

data.description: Rows with results for the query.

meta.description: Additional results metadata for the query.

count.description: Total number of results available for this query.

status.description: HTTP status code for the error.

detail.description: Additional information about the error.

parameter.description: Path to the parameter that caused the error.

status.description: HTTP status code for the error.

detail.description: Additional information about the error.

status.description: HTTP status code for the error.

detail.description: Additional information about the error.

post.description:
API that allows fetching raw sessions from the database (event-level data
is not available in this API). Please note that each request must be
authenticated.

#### Compression

When requesting large amount of data, make sure to include
an **Accept-Encoding: gzip** header to enable
compression.

data.description: Rows with results for the query.

meta.description: Additional results metadata for the query.

count.description: Total number of results available for this query.

status.description: HTTP status code for the error.

detail.description: Additional information about the error.

parameter.description: Path to the parameter that caused the error.

status.description: HTTP status code for the error.

detail.description: Additional information about the error.

status.description: HTTP status code for the error.

detail.description: Additional information about the error.

post.description:
API that allows fetching raw events from the database. Please note that
each request must be authenticated.

#### Compression

When requesting large amount of data, make sure to include
an **Accept-Encoding: gzip** header to enable
compression.s

post.description:
Create a new goal.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

get.description:
Returns a list all goals available for a website.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

Returns a definition of a specific goal.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

put.description:
Update an existing goal.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

delete.description:
Delete the specified goal.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

post.description: Configure new custom dimension.

get.description: Returns a list all custom dimensions available for a website.
Returns a definition of a specific custom dimension.
Returns statistics about available custom dimension slots.

post.description:
Create a new user annotation.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

get.description:
Returns a list all user annotations available for a website.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

Returns a definition of a specific user annotation.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

patch.description:
Update an existing user annotation.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

delete.description:
Delete the specified user annotation.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

get.description:
Returns a list all System Annotations available for a website.
Please note that each request must be authenticated.

actions.description: List of available actions for a given entity

targetUserId.description: UUIDv4 identifier of user which will receive permissions

permissions.description: List of global actions for authorized user

JsonApiType.description: Resource type, unique across whole PPAS

AppPermission.description: Permission for `ppms/app` (for example `edit-publish` contains actions `view`, `edit` and `publish`)

MetaSitePermission.description: Permission for `ppms/meta-site` (for example `manage` contains actions `view` nad `edit`)

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value

title.description: a short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Like `title`, this field’s value can be localized

source.description: an object containing references to the source of the error, optionally including any of the following members: [pointer, parameter]

pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/name" for a specific attribute]

parameter.description: a string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error

App_Urls.description: List of URL's under which the app is available (each URL needs to start with ``http://`` or ``https://``)

App_Timezone.description: It allows to specify the timezone for your app (using IANA format), and tracked data will show date & time of this time zone. Please note that changing the timezone will not affect previous logs in reports.

App_Currency.description: App currency. It specifies the default currency for Goal revenues shown in Analytics. By default, Analytics reports display revenue in US dollars.

App_Organization.description: Organization to which an app belongs to

JsonApi_Type.description: Resource type, unique across whole PPAS

type.description: Resource type, unique across whole PPAS
Resource type, unique across whole PPAS

excludeUnknownUrls.description: Track only visits and actions when URL starts with one of `urls`

keepUrlFragment.description: Disable this setting to exclude Page URL fragments (everything after #, e.g. `example.org/index.html#first_section` will be tracked as `example.org.index.html`)

eCommerceTracking.description: Enables e-commerce reports, additional tab is shown in Analytics module with e-commerce logs. Sales can be easily tracked using this setting.

siteSearchTracking.description:
To disable internal search engine tracking, just set `site_search_category_params` and `site_search_query_params` to empty lists (`[]`) in Tracker Settings.

Track and report what users are searching in your apps internal search engine

siteSearchQueryParams.description: Site search query params for an app

siteSearchCategoryParams.description: Site search category params for an app

delay.description: Delay (in ms) is used to slow down actions (e.g. redirect) when waiting for tags to be resolved

excludedIps.description: List of IPs (IPv4 and IPv6) to blacklist from tracking, e.g `192.168.0.0` or `2607:f0d0:1002:51::4`. You can use wildcards, e.g. `1.2.3.*`, `1.2.*.*` or `::7:*`

excludedUrlParams.description: URL query parameters excluded by default from tracking: `gclid`, `fb_xd_fragment`, `fb_comment_id`, `phpsessid`, `jsessid`, `aspsessid`, `doing_wp_cron`, `sid` and `pk_vid`. Regular expressions such as `/^sess.*|.*[dD]ate$/` are supported

excludedUserAgents.description: If the visitor's user agent string contains any of the strings you specify, the visitor will be excluded from tracking
example: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2228.0
Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.2; Win64; x64) Presto/2.12 Version/12.16

gdpr.description: Enable collection of privacy consent for full GDPR compliance. The compliance form will be triggered if you serve your users tags that require consent

gdprUserModeEnabled.description: Gdpr User Mode enabled or disabled for an app

privacyCookieDomainsEnabled.description: Privacy cookie domains enabled or disabled for an app

privacyCookieExpirationPeriod.description: Privacy cookie expiration period (in seconds, default is one year)

privacyCookieDomains.description: List of privacy cookie domains for an app (works if `privacyCookieDomainsEnabled` is true), you can also use wildcards like ``*.example.com``

gdprLocationRecognition.description: Use geolocation to detect UE visitors and present consent forms only to them

gdprDataAnonymization.description: Track only a minimal amount of users data, for which we don't need to gather their consent. Any data points considered as personally identifiable information will not be tracked unless the consent is provided

privacyUseCookies.description: Use cookies to recognize new and returning visitors

privacyUseFingerprinting.description: Use fingerprinting to recognize new and returning visitors

sessionIdStrictPrivacyMode.description: Don't collect visitor’s device data (compliace with the German Data Protection Act - TTDSG)

Ip.description: Event author ip address (IPv4 or IPv6)

Version.description: Version of an event (e.g. version `1` of `app.added` could be not compatible with version `2`)

parameter.description: string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. This field’s value can be localized
detail.example: '512.xxx.123' does not appear to be an IPv4 or IPv6 address

MetaSiteName.description: Unique name of a meta site

Timezone.description: Timezone in IANA time zone format (like Europe/Warsaw), or UTC offset (like UTC+1)

DefaultTimezone.description: Timezone in IANA time zone format (like Europe/Warsaw), or UTC offset (like UTC+1)

ECommerceTracking.description: Enables e-commerce reports, additional tab is shown in Analytics module with e-commerce logs. Sales can be easily tracked using this setting.

DefaultECommerceTracking.description: Enables e-commerce reports, additional tab is shown in Analytics module with e-commerce logs. Sales can be easily tracked using this setting.

Organization.description: Organization to which a resource belongs to

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Like `title`, this field’s value can be localized

source.description: an object containing references to the source of the error, optionally including any of the following members: [pointer, parameter]

pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/name" for a specific attribute]

Urls.description:
List of app valid urls.  Used mostly to detect referrers and to exclude traffic if `exclude_unknown_urls` is enabled.
```
This value is created when a new website is added.
```

ExcludeUnknownUrls.description:
When enabled, tracker discards all requests originating from urls absent in `urls` collection
```
Initial global value:
  false
```

ExcludedIps.description:
List of IPs to blacklist from tracking. You can use wildcards, e.g. ``1.2.3.*`` or ``1.2.*.*``
```
Initial global value:
  []
```

UrlQueryParameterToExcludeFromUrl.description:
URL query parameters excluded from tracking, like: ``gclid``, ``fb_xd_fragment``, ``fb_comment_id``. Regular expressions such as ``/^sess.*|.*[dD]ate$/`` are supported.
```
Initial global value:
  [
    gclid,
    fbclid,
    fb_xd_fragment,
    fb_comment_id,
    phpsessid,
    jsessionid,
    sessionid,
    aspsessionid,
    doing_wp_cron,
    sid,
    pk_vid
  ]
```

ExcludedUserAgents.description:
If the visitor's user agent string contains any of the strings you specify, the visitor will be excluded from tracking.
```
Initial global value:
  []
```
example: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2228.0
Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.2; Win64; x64) Presto/2.12 Version/12.16

FingerprintBasedOnAnonymizedIp.description:
When enabled, visitor geolocation calculation is based on anonymized IP instead of real one.
```
Initial global value:
  false
```

KeepUrlFragment.description:
When disabled, everything after #, e.g. ``example.org/index.html#first_section`` will be tracked as ``example.org.index.html``
```
Initial global value:
  true
```

SiteSearchQueryParams.description:
URL query parameters that are used for site search in an app. If you want to have this parameters removed from URLs in reports enable ``strip_site_search_query_parameters`` setting.
```
Initial global value:
  [
    q,
    query,
    s,
    search,
    searchword,
    keyword
  ]
```

SiteSearchCategoryParams.description:
URL query parameters that are used for site search category in an app. If you want to have this parameters removed from URLs in reports enable ``strip_site_search_query_parameters`` setting.
```
Initial global value:
  []
```

AnonymizeVisitorIpLevel.description:
Anonymize "n" octets of Visitors IP addresses. All events and sessions that are processed will have ther IP transformed. For example, when you anonymize 2 last octetsm incoming IP 10.76.143.250 will be trasformed to 10.76.0.0. Such transformed IP will be used to aggregate data.
```
Initial global value:
  0
```

AnonymizeVisitorGeolocationLevel.description:
When enabled, some geolocation data will be removed from the events an session. For example, if you set to remove data at country level, the geolocation match will be as accurate as possible, but City and Region data will be removed in the process. Country and Continent data will be accurate. This transformed data will be used in aggregation.
```
Initial global value:
  none
```

CreateNewVisitWhenWebsiteReferrerChanges.description:
When enabled, a new session is created each time when refferrer type or name changes during the session, even if the `visit_standard_length` did not expire.
```
Initial global value:
  false
```

CreateNewVisitWhenCampaignChanges.description:
When enabled, a new session is created each time when campaign type or name changes during the session, even if the `visit_standard_length` did not expire.
```
Initial global value:
  false
```

TrustVisitorsCookies.description:
When enabled, session events wont be matched by a device fingerprint. Only vistor side generated `_id` paramater will be taken into account.
```
Initial global value:
  false
```

CampaignNameParams.description:
URL query parameters that could contain name of the campaign. Processor will search for the paramters listed in this setting and it will set dimension ``campaign_name`` to the first parameter that matches name.
```
Initial global value:
  [
    pk_campaign,
    piwik_campaign,
    pk_cpn,
    utm_campaign
  ]
```

CampaignKeywordParams.description:
URL query parameters that could contain keywords for the campaign. Processor will search for the paramters listed in this setting and it will set dimension ``campaign_keyword`` to the first parameter that matches name.
```
Initial global value:
  [
    pk_medium,
    utm_medium
  ]
```

CampaignSourceParams.description:
URL query parameters that could contain sources for the campaign. Processor will search for the paramters listed in this setting and it will set dimension ``campaign_source`` to the first parameter that matches name.
```
Initial global value:
  [
    pk_source,
    utm_source
  ]
```

CampaignMediumParams.description:
URL query parameters that could contain mediums for the campaign. Processor will search for the paramters listed in this setting and it will set dimension ``campaign_medium`` to the first parameter that matches name.
```
Initial global value:
  [
    pk_medium,
    utm_medium
  ]
```

CampaignContentParams.description:
URL query parameters that could contain content of the campaign. Processor will search for the paramters listed in this setting and it will set dimension ``campaign_content`` to the first parameter that matches name.
```
Initial global value:
  [
    pk_content,
    utm_content
  ]
```

CampaignIdParams.description:
URL query parameters that could contain an ID of the campaign. Processor will search for the paramters listed in this setting and it will set dimension ``campaign_id`` to the first parameter that matches name.
```
Initial global value:
  [
    pk_cid,
    utm_id
  ]
```

EnableFingerprintingAcrossWebsites.description:
When this option is enabled tracker will try to generate unified visitor_id even when user visits different websites.
```
Initial global value:
  false
```

TrackingFingerprintDisabled.description:
Enabling this, will make tracker to use fingerprint from cookie. If you want to use this setting make sure to enable `trust_visitors_cookies`.
```
Initial global value:
  false
```

StripSiteSearchQueryParameters.description:
When enabled, all of parameters set in `site_search_query_params` and `site_search_category_params` will be removed from report URLs.
```
Initial global value:
  false
```

ExcludeCrawlers.description:
When disabled, crawler bots will be tracked like the regular visitors.
```
Initial global value:
  true
```

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Like `title`, this field’s value can be localized

source.description: an object containing references to the source of the error, optionally including any of the following members: [pointer, parameter]

pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. '/data' for a primary data object, or '/data/attributes/name' for a specific attribute]

parameter.description: a string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value

title.description: a short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization

PermissionGroup.description: Permission group (for example `edit-publish` contains permissions `view`, `edit` and `publish`)

User_Password.description: Valid password (length between 8 and 128 chars, it must contain at least one digit, one uppercase and one lowercase letter)

Date.description: Datetime with time zone in ISO-8601 format

Language.description: User Interface language with IETF language tag format

JsonApi_Type1.description: Resource type, unique across whole PPAS

type.description: Resource type, unique across whole PPAS
Resource type, unique across whole PPAS

website_id.description: ID of a website or a meta site.

column_id.description: ID of the column (either a dimension or a metric).

transformation_id.description:
Optional ID of the transformation. Must be supported by the
column that was specified.

goal_id.description: Optional ID of a goal. Available only for metrics related to goals.

date_from.description: Start date for the query (inclusive). Cannot be used with relative_date field at the same time. Mandatory if ``relative_date`` is not used.

date_to.description: End date for the query (inclusive). Cannot be used with ``relative_date`` field at the same time. Mandatory if ``relative_date`` is not used.

relative_date.description:
Use relative date in query. Cannot be used with absolute date fields at
the same time. ``X`` in ``last_X_days`` must be in range 1 <= ``X`` <= 365.
Note that ``last_X_days`` does not include data from today.
Mandatory if absolute date fields are not used.

filters.description:
Dimension filters for the query.  The top-level object must specify
AND/OR clause, but any nested objects may either specify another AND/OR
clause or a single filter.

conditions.description: List of filters or recursively nested clauses.

column_id.description: ID of the column (must be a dimension).

transformation_id.description:
Optional ID of the transformation. Must be supported by
the column that was specified and must convert the column
into another dimension (and not a metric).

condition.description: Definition of a the condition for this column.

operator.description:
Filtering operator. Available choices depend on
the specified column's type.

String operators: ``eq``, ``neq``,
``contains``, ``not_contains``,
``icontains``, ``not_icontains``,
``starts_with``, ``ends_with``,
``matches``, ``not_matches``. For regular expressions (operators: ``matches`` and ``not_matches``)
use [re2](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax) syntax.

Numeric operators: ``eq``, ``neq``, ``gt``, ``gte``,
``lt``, ``lte``.

Boolean operators: ``eq``, ``neq``.

Enum operators: ``eq``, ``neq``, ``empty``, ``not_empty``.

value.description:
Value that should be matched by filter. Value type must
match the type of the specified column. For enumerated
fields, you must use the ID value.

metric_filters.description:
Metric filters for the query. The top-level object must specify AND/OR
clause, but any nested objects may either specify another AND/OR
clause or a single filter.

conditions.description: List of filters or recursively nested clauses.

column_id.description:
ID of the column (must be a metric, or a dimension converted
to a metric).

transformation_id.description:
Optional ID of the transformation. Must be supported by
the column that was specified and must convert the column
into a metric.

goal_id.description:
Specify a goal ID to calculate the metric using data limited
to that goal only. Supported only by goal-related metrics.

condition.description: Definition of a the condition for this column.

value.description: Value that should be matched by filter.

offset.description: Number of rows to skip before beginning to return rows.

order_by.description:
Array of sorting directives. Each directive is a 2-element array with
0-based colum index and direction). You can sort on more than one column.
By default sorts descending by the first metric in query.

format.description: Data format of a successful response (error responses are always in json).

column_format.description:
Format of the columns header (in CSV responses) and metadata labels
(in JSON responses). By default uses identifiers (``id`` option), set to
``name`` to use human-readable names.

sampling.description:
Apply sampling for query with given data percent. Sampling 0.1 means
only 10% of data are used to calculate query results. Sampling 1
means that 100% of data is used to calculate results. Leave empty to
apply default sampling value for this website. By default this means
that sampling is turned off.

website_id.description: ID of a website or a meta site.

columns.description:
Definitions of additional columns that should be returned (timestamp and
identifiers will be returned by default).

transformation_id.description:
Optional ID of the transformation. Must be supported by
the column that was specified and must convert the column
into another dimension (and not a metric).

date_from.description: Start date for the query (inclusive). Cannot be used with relative_date field at the same time. Mandatory if ``relative_date`` is not used.

date_to.description: End date for the query (inclusive). Cannot be used with ``relative_date`` field at the same time. Mandatory if ``relative_date`` is not used.

relative_date.description:
Use relative date in query. Cannot be used with absolute date fields at
the same time. ``X`` in ``last_X_days`` must be in range 1 <= ``X`` <= 365.
Note that ``last_X_days`` does not include data from today.
Mandatory if absolute date fields are not used.

Dimension filters for the query. The top-level object must specify
AND/OR clause, but any nested objects may either specify another AND/OR
clause or a single filter.

conditions.description: List of filters or recursively nested clauses.

Filtering operator. Available choices depend on

String operators: ``eq``, ``neq``,
``starts_with``, ``ends_with``.
``starts_with``, ``ends_with``,

description.example: Goal is triggered when user enters contact page

pattern_type.description: Condition operator for goal trigger. Required for non-manual triggers.

DateFrom.name: date_from
DateFrom.description:
Start date for the query (inclusive). You can specify mulitple dates which will be paired with corresponding `date_to` parameters. For example `?date_from=2020-01-01&date_to=2020-01-10&date_from=2021-06-01&date_to=2021-07-01` will create two ranges: `[2020-01-01; 2020-01-10]` and `[2021-06-01; 2021-07-01]`.
Number of `date_from` parameters must match number of `date_to` parameters.

DateTo.name: date_to
DateTo.description: End date for the query (inclusive). You can specify mulitple dates which will be paired with corresponding `date_to` parameters. Read more in `date_from` parameter description.

Offset2.name: offset
Offset2.description: Number of rows to skip before beginning to return rows.
